FlavorTextOption.Text: Ranom lesitir yacasus cerin, sab omoric ero re metini tibu. (You need to research Universal Translator)
We are very grateful. We will not forget your generosity.
Ranom lesitir yacasus cerin, sab omoric ero re metini tibu. (You need to research Universal Translator)

We are sorry, but we cannot vindicate assisting you at this time. Perhaps if we had closer relations we could find the funds... but as things stand, we think we are better off keeping our assets to ourselves.
Do we LOOK like the kind of people who give charity to aliens?
Did you just seriously ask for money from a civilization that practices slavery?
This must be some kind of trick. Go away!
Ranom lesitir yacasus cerin, sab omoric ero re metini tibu. (You need to research Universal Translator)
That is unfortunate, maybe next time.
Ranom lesitir yacasus cerin, sab omoric ero re metini tibu. (You need to research Universal Translator)
Thank you very much, we are very grateful for the support. The generosity of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will be remembered throughout the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} for years to come.
Ranom lesitir yacasus cerin, sab omoric ero re metini tibu. (You need to research Universal Translator)
You're welcome, we only hope this will bring our civilizations closer together in the future.
Ranom lesitir yacasus cerin, sab omoric ero re metini tibu. (You need to research Universal Translator)
We have no interest in being in your debt for anything. If you would like to assist us, stay out of our way.
Ranom lesitir yacasus cerin, sab omoric ero re metini tibu. (You need to research Universal Translator)
Sorry you feel that way.
(you need to research Universal Translator in order to trade)
I have a trade proposal for you.
(you cannot trade with someone you are in a war with)
(you cannot trade with someone you are in a war with)
(you cannot talk with someone you are in a war with)
(you cannot talk with someone you are in a war with)
(you need to research Universal Translator in order to converse)
I would like to speak to you about something.
(you need to research Universal Translator in order to converse)
I have something else in mind...
GO AWAY, YOU DON'T MAKE SENSE
Goodbye.
Greetings, {LEADERNAME:2}. As a civilization living in the shadow of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}, it would be proper for you to provide us with {AMOUNT:2} credits as a showing of respect.
{LEADERNAME:2}, it's time you admit the might of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}. We demand {AMOUNT:2} credits from your pathetic empire.
Consider it a tithe of {AMOUNT:2} credits for your devotion to our cause.
Expenses are on the rise and we will need an additional {AMOUNT:2} credits from you.
Very well, the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will give you what you want, for now.
Our race has an infinite memory. We will not forget this veiled threat.
Your civilization forced us to pay before. We paid. But it did not end well for you.
Making me give you stuff for free isn't going to make us less angry. But death won't either. So fine, take it.
You have the advantage now. So we will agree to your demand. But when you live as my slaveling we will revisit this day.
The {PLAYERFACTION:2} will not be pushed around... and the magnitude of your might is questionable.
The {PLAYERFACTION:2} do not fear you.
Piss off.
You're bluffing
I'm going to bet you're not serious.
You're going to regret this.
A dangerous mistake.
As an empire of great power, it is only appropriate for the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} to receive tribute from the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2}... let's say to the tune of {AMOUNT:2} credits per month?
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will comply with this request, for now.
Great power? Don't be ridiculous; hit the road, {LEADERNAME:1}.
Wrong answer. I'm sure you'll see the consequences of your mistake soon enough.

Despite our prodigious strength compared to the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2}, we find you do have knowledge that we still lack. Give us information about {TECHNAME:2}, and we may overlook the temptation to take advantage of your relative weakness.
Very well, the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will give you what you want, for now.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} will not be pushed around... and the magnitude of your might is questionable.
You're going to regret this.
We are being attacked by the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. Please, {LEADERNAME:2}, help us out by giving us {AMOUNT:2} credits.
I agree.
We appreciate your help.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} has its own problems. No.
We are being attacked by the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. We could use your help, {LEADERNAME:2}. Would you provide us with {TECHNAME:2}?
I agree.
Thank you for sharing your technology.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} has its own problems. No.
We are being attacked by the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. The situation is dire, {LEADERNAME:2}. Only if you declare war on the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} can we hope to survive.
I agree.
Your aid is appreciated.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} has its own problems. No.

The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} comes to you with an opportunity: The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} are dangerous, and we would appreciate aid in being rid of them. Would you accept {AMOUNT:1} credits to do this for us?
We will declare war on the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} for the benefit of both of our civilizations.
I knew we could count on you. Thank you!
We cannot accept your offer. The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} have other endeavors that demand our attention.

I'm sure you agree that the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} is a blight on this galaxy. Rise up to your responsibility and declare war on them; we will provide {AMOUNT:1} credits to remove any concern of expense.
We will declare war on the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. We stand together.
We are not interested in being mercenaries for your benefit, {LEADERNAME:1}.
You will be forced to take a side soon enough, then you will wish you had taken our generous offer.

The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} comes to you with an opportunity: The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} are a menace. We believe preemptive action is the best path to prevent them from becoming an overwhelming threat.
However, we are not currently in a position to deal with them. Therefore, if you declare war on them, we will give you the knowledge of {TECHNAME:1} to aid in your fight.
We will declare war on the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} and work together for the benefit of our empires.
I knew we could count on you. Thank you!
We must decline this offer. We are currently focused on other endeavors at this time.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} would like to mark our friendship with a gift of {AMOUNT:1} credits.
Thank you for this gift.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1} would like to mark our friendship with a gift of knowledge of {TECHNAME:1}.
Thank you for this gift.
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} have been destroyed.
Understood.
Your starbase {OBJECTNAME} is a direct threat to our interests. We demand that you remove it at once.
Fine, we will destroy it immediately.
Excellent, you have the appreciation of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}.
No, the starbase is staying right where it is.
You understand that this throws your intentions into question, {LEADERNAME:2}.
I want your starbase {OBJECTNAME}. If you don't give it to us, we will take it from you by force.
Calm yourself. We will remove it.
You made the right choice.
No, thanks.
Then war it is.
We want your starbase {OBJECTNAME}, it has an ascension crystal. We'll give you {AMOUNT:1} for it.
Okay.
Excellent, you have the appreciation of the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:1}.
No.
We won't give up on this, {LEADERNAME:2}.
It's time to end this war. Would you accept these terms?
The {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} has knowledge that we are interested in. Would you accept this in exchange?
{PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2}, we see you building up forces outside our doorstep. You should stop it.
{PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2}, we see you building up forces outside our doorstep. You should stop it.
{PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2}, we see you building up forces outside our doorstep. You should stop it.
{PLAYERFACTIONLONG:2} Even though we like you, we don't like the military build up that we're seeing.
Nothing to see here...
Why don't you stop me?
Nothing to see here...
You need to trust us, friend.
We'll just see about this.
We'll just see about this.
We'll be watching you.
I hope, for your sake, that our trust isn't misplaced.
We should warn you, {LEADERNAME:2}, the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3} have built up a powerful military. Be wary of them.
Thanks for the warning. We'll be careful.
Always.
It looks like you're having a bit of trouble with the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}, {LEADERNAME:2}. Please accept this {OBJECTNAME:1} from us to help with your war effort.
Your help comes at a perfect time. Thank you.
We always help our friends.
{LEADERNAME:2}, you win. We surrender and will turn over all of our remaining assets into your hands.
I'm glad you saw reason.

We may be finished, {LEADERNAME:2}, but you're a fool if you think we'll hand our people over to your custody. All of our remaining assets will be turned over to our friends the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}.
Do as you wish, though it will make little difference in the end.

We have no choice, {LEADERNAME:2}, we have to surrender to the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}. You've been good to us in the past so it is our wish to give you the remainder of our empire. Use our resources to strike back at the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG:3}!
Thanks.
Now that you've colonized a planet, demonstrate that you won't be stuck there. Build a shipyard.
Fine, I [I]guess[/I]...
How the heck am I supposed to do that?
I'm sure this will clarify things for you.
Finally. Time to build a constructor ship so you can start to expand.
Alright...
You're so good at following instructions. Build a starbase with that constructor... and you know what? Put it wherever you want, as a treat.
My, you certainly are demanding...
You monster.
No regrets, Drengi forever.
That's a nice planet you've got there, that {OBJECTNAME}. How about you hand it over? We'll pay {AMOUNT:1}, of course... we are not thieves. But refuse, and no more diplomacy for you.
Gulp, fine.
How about no?
Oh man, you done goofed now.
Sure I did.
Rejoice, for your test is successful.
Huzzah.
We tend to weigh the profitability of the trade route over the ideological choices of that civilization.
End Communication
Big talk from a puny power.
Are you looking for us to destroy you?
You are really tempting fate.
I will ignore those words this time.
You may live to regret your insolence.
An unfortunate attitude.
Shouldn't you be oiling yourself or something?
For a space robot, you have a lot of attitude.
Shouldn't you be making me some toast right about now?
We will correspond with whomever we so choose.
Their money is as good as anyone else's.
From our perspective, you are all equally worthy to be our slaves.
We think all of you are pretty gross.
We have little interest in the dogmas of organics.
We are glad to hear that.
We shall resist you!
We are machines. Your boasts are irrelevant.
I'm sorry, but we must continue our quest for ultimate knowledge.
I think any would-be enemy would discover that we are tougher than we look.
You may find that it would be a fatal mistake to attack us.
According to the pamphlets, ascension means hanging out with lions and lambs and tables of fruit.
Ah, that. Well, everyone knows that ginger and chocolate are the most powerful things in the universe.
We cannot help that people are interested in the wonderful products of MetaAppleDisneyGooglePlus.
You biologics need to be educated on the superiority of machines.
Well, to be honest, I had hoped you wouldn't notice...
I understand. It's just that our culture is so wonderful.
You clearly have never tasted chocolate.
Huh?
I have no idea what was just said.
This is a PG rated discussion. In other words, probably best not to explore the details.
We shall see.
Acknowledged.
Acknowledged.
Understood.
We will take what you have said under advisement.
We understand.
We will take your message under advisement.

Through your creative use of guns, ships and ships with guns, you have put your boot on the galaxy's neck. All of your enemies have been crushed, their planets beaten into submission, and their citizens made to wave your flag. It wasn't pretty, but it never had to be, did it?

Your culture has spread across the entire galaxy. Aliens everywhere are seeking to emulate the ways of your people, adding or removing limbs as necessary to better fit their vision of the perfect life you lead. Who needs to conquer the bodies when you already own their hearts and minds?

Using your powerful brains, your culture has unlocked the secrets of not only this universe, but the one beyond. Let the simpletons of the galaxy squabble over the dust and fragments of rock they squat upon. For your people, something far greater beckons.

Your study of the ways of the Precursors is complete, and your people will soon be indistinguishable from the Precursors themselves. Having mastered their technology and way of thinking, your people are about to set out on a journey that the lesser minds of this galaxy cannot even begin to comprehend.

Another race has followed the path of the Precursors and ascended. Though our destruction is not immediate, you have led us to become evolutionary obsolete. Our spaceships and lasers have little meaning to a race beyond mortality, to whom time and space are children's toys. To them, we aren't even truly sentient, we are dust blowing around the galaxy, ignored or destroyed as their whims dictate.

And with the stroke of a pen, peace was finally at hand. A peace that would last, for it had been laid on a foundation of mutual trust and respect. With their minds and resources no longer wasted on the unending thirst of war, a new golden age of prosperity soon descends upon your people and its allies.

For years, your people fought and struggled on the galactic stage with your ambitious and conniving neighbors. Although no single race ever gained a decisive edge, when the conflict turned into a war of attrition, it was your people who ultimately ended in the best position.

For years, your people fought and struggled on the galactic stage with your ambitious and conniving neighbors. Although no single race ever gained a decisive edge, when the conflict turned into a war of attrition, it was your people who ultimately ended in the best position.
You shouldn't be seeing this.

And with that, your civilization collapsed. For a time, your people lived on, scattered around the galaxy as refugees and hermits. But your species' power never returned. Will your people be remembered in museums and textbooks, or wiped from the memories of all beings? You'll never know. It's not up to you to say anymore.

Building a galaxy spanning civilization takes a long time, and not everyone has the patience for it. Will your people understand that you did the best you could, or will they curse you for abandoning them while aliens devour their bones? Don't let it keep you up at night (you should let it keep you up at night).
Our Diplomat {OBJECTNAME} has stolen {AMOUNT:2} credits from the {PLAYERFACTION:3}
Our Diplomat {OBJECTNAME} stole the {TECHNAME:2} technology from the {PLAYERFACTION:3}.
Keep up the good work.
Fill Description
What foul pollutant of a creature crosses my screen?
It's nice to meet you and your kind, Korath.
Mind your manners, Korath. You won't intimidate anyone here.
Make this quick, alien scum.
How wretched a life you must live, not being one of us. Soon it will be over, for you and all your kind.
You've proven your strength, alien. Enough with this fighting. Let us tend to our wounds.
Look, alien. An offer and a gift. You'd be a fool not to accept.
We accept your offer, alien.
The galaxy is awash in filthy aliens. It's sickening.
Do you ever tire of the sounds your hideous face makes? I do.
Don't waste my time our yours with idle chatter. But mostly don't waste mine.
Nice to talk to you too, Korath.
You seem uglier than normal today.

We are scheduled for an election in 5 weeks. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]lose by a landslide[/COLOR].
Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.

We are scheduled for an election in 5 weeks. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]lose, but it will be close[/COLOR]. We should focus on increasing morale.
Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.

We are scheduled for an election in 5 weeks. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]win, but it will be close[/COLOR]. We can't allow morale to drop.
Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.

We are scheduled for an election in 5 weeks. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]win by a landslide[/COLOR].
Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.
Let's review our Economic options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Economy screen)[/COLOR]
Let's review our Government options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]
Give me a moment.

Our government is insufficient for the needs of our growing civilization. New colonies complain that the government only serves the homeworld and decisions across our worlds are becoming increasingly delayed by deeper and deeper levels of bureaucracy.
Governments are only effective at managing a certain number of worlds. After this [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Colony Limit[/COLOR] is exceeded we will suffer a Morale penalty for each Colony we control beyond this limit.
Let's review our Government options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]
Give me a moment.

Our government is insufficient for the needs of our growing civilization. New colonies complain that the government only serves the homeworld and decisions across our worlds are becoming increasingly delayed by bureaucracy.
Governments are only effective at managing a certain number of worlds. After this [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Colony Limit[/COLOR] is exceeded we suffer a Morale penalty for each Colony beyond this limit. Unfortunately we haven't discovered any governments that increase our Colony Limit. We should discover technologies that allow more advanced forms of government, either by research or by trading with other civilizations.
Let's review our Research options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Research screen)[/COLOR]
Give me a moment.
Now that we have expanded beyond our homeworld, the colonists are crying out for structure. It is time for us to choose a form of government that is ready to handle a galactic civilization.
Great, let's get started! [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]
Give me a moment.
[I]"Your incompetence is the stuff of legend."[/I]
[I]"You are leading our empire to ruin."[/I]
[I]"We survive despite your mediocre leadership."[/I]
[I]"Our empire flourishes because of your rule."[/I]
[I]"You have my eternal support."[/I]
[I]"I serve you with honor."[/I]
[I]"You are a competent, but not exceptional, ruler."[/I]
[I]"You are an able steward of our empire, but we should aspire for more."[/I]
[I]"I have no strong opinion one way or the other."[/I]
